subject: Circuses
Paralympic Games
lead_paragraph: Djamel Mastouri of France, who won a bronze medal in the 800 meters at the Paralympics in September, is far from Beijing’s Bird’s Nest stadium, taming lions at a Paris circus. Mastouri, who has been training for weeks, will replace the well-known lion tamer Frederic Edelstein for a special show at the Pinder circus on Thursday. Eight acts will be performed by French disabled athletes at the show, called Handicircus Gala and also featuring French artists and celebrities.
